intro: Mitreola swartzii, commonly known as the African butterbean, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny, spherical seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and medicinal potential, it is of interest to botanists and herbalists alike.
